meanings.definition: To print or type in italic typeface.
meanings.sent1: I will *italicize* the title of the book.
meanings.sent2: Please remember to *italicize* the important information.
meanings.sent3: The teacher asked the student to *italicize* the key terms, but they accidentally made everything italic.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like *italicized* whispers in the wind, barely noticeable but full of meaning.
meanings.sent5: The *italicized* words on the page stood out like stars in a dark sky.

meanings.definition: To emphasize or highlight a word or phrase by using italic typeface.
meanings.sent1: You can *italicize* the key points to make them stand out.
meanings.sent2: It is common practice to *italicize* important names in a text.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to *italicize* the secret ingredient in the recipe, making everyone curious.
meanings.sent4: His eyes seemed to *italicize* the urgency of the situation, silently pleading for help.
meanings.sent5: The *italicized* words added a touch of elegance to the document, drawing attention to the crucial details.
